sentence.Network_en: Johnson's smashing victory in 1964 changed the political horizon substantially.
sentence.Network_cn: 1964年约翰逊的大获成功给政界带来了翻天覆地的变化。

sentence.Network_en: The percentage of girls in engineering has increased substantially.
sentence.Network_cn: 学工科的女孩的比例已经大大增加了。

entry.def: If something changes substantially or is substantially different, it changes a lot or is very different.

example.ex: The percentage of girls in engineering has increased substantially...
example.tran: 学工科的女孩的比例已经大大增加了。

example.ex: The skin of an eighty-year-old looks substantially different from that of a twenty-year-old...
example.tran: 80 岁人的皮肤与 20 岁人的皮肤看起来有天壤之别。

entry.tran: 基本上;大体上;总的来说
entry.def: If you say that something is substantially correct or unchanged, you mean that it is mostly correct or mostly unchanged.

example.ex: He checked the details given and found them substantially correct...
example.tran: 他核实了一下给出的细节，发现它们基本正确。

example.ex: BBC Television remains otherwise substantially unchanged.
example.tran: 而英国广播公司的电视节目在其他方面基本没有变化。

means.word_mean: 1. to a great extent or degree;

sentences.sentence: "I'm afraid the film was well over budget"
"painting the room white made it seem considerably (or substantially) larger"
"the house has fallen considerably in value"

sentences.en: The price may go up quite substantially.
